result.execSummary:
The defendant Mara A Forti Hance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED, COSTS PAID IN FULL
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.
Notify any treatment physicians of this case.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Defendant Mara A Forti Hance in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  State is ready to proceed to hearing.  Defense is ready to proceed to hearing.  State calls their witness Officer Nicholas Hendriksen, with the City of Waukesha Police Dept.  Officer Hendriksen sworn and testifies on direct.  Cross examination by Atty. Fragoso.  Testimony rests, witness is excused.  State rests.  Defense rests.  State moves to bind over.  Defense objects.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
